original: Morphogenesis, the process by which organisms develop their body forms, results from spatial differences in gene expression. A subset of genes within an organism's genome, known as the developmental-genetic toolkit, plays a crucial role in this development. These toolkit genes are highly conserved across various phyla, indicating their ancient origins and similarity among diverse animal groups. Variations in the expression and deploymen
